item.title: Jen add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "This book taught me, once and for all, how easily you can escape this world with the help of words! You can find friends between the pages of a book, wonderful friends." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Jen add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Every gathering has its moment. As an adult, I distract myself by trying to identify it, dreading the inevitable downswing that is sure to follow. The guests will repeat themselves one too many times, or you'll run out of dope or liquor and realize that it was all you ever had in common." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Jen add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jen add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jen add a quote by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
item.description: "Friends are God's way of apologizing for your family." -- Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jen add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I love the friends I have gathered together on this thin raft..." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Jen add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Jen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Yet Byron never made tea as you do, who fill the pot so that when you put the lid on the tea spills over. There is a brown pool on the table--it is running among your books and papers. Now you mop it up, clumsily, with your pocket-hankerchief. You then stuff your hankerchief back into your pocket--that is not Byron; that is so essentially you that if I think of you in twenty years' time, when we are both famous, gouty and intolerable, it will be by that scene: and if you are dead, I shall weep." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jen add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "A friend is one to whom one may pour out the contents of one's heart, chaff and grain together, knowing that gentle hands will take and sift it, keep what is worth keeping, and with a breath of kindness, blow the rest away." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nella Larsen
item.description: "What are friends for, if not to help bear our sins?" -- Nella Larsen

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When we think of friends, and call their faces out of the shadows, and their voices out of the echoes that faint along the corridors of memory, and do it without knowing why save that we love to do it, we content ourselves that that friendship is a Reality, and not a Fancy--that it is builded upon a rock, and not upon the sands that dissolve away with the ebbing tides and carry their monuments with them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "It is easy enough to be friendly to one's friends. But to befriend the one who regards himself as your enemy is the quintessence of true religion. The other is mere business." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jen add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "I told Mama and Savannah about Ruben's proposal. That got us to talking about marriage and we laughed and cried some, and missed Papa, and it felt good to belong to each other. I don't feel as lonely today as I have in months. At least I know there are other women around me. " -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jen add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Jen add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jen add a quote by Stephen Cosgrove
item.description: "Why are you crying?" shivered the otter. "Because I am cold!" shouted the gnome. "Then why are you shouting?" chattered the otter. "Because," yelled the gnome, "when I shout it gets part of the cold from the inside out." -- Stephen Cosgrove

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "Everyone wants to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: Jen add a quote by Stephen Cosgrove
item.description: "A friend cannot be owned That is plain to see Friendships must be shared, Just like our friend, Ruby" -- Stephen Cosgrove

item.title: Jen add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "There's not a word yet, for old friends who've just met." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Jen add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by William Stafford
item.description: "Wisdom is having things right in your life and knowing why." -- William Stafford

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Never, never, never give in!" -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jen add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken
